TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content: I have to wait another two weeks before I can reach my Xbox one (Halo 5, Fallout 4, I'm coming home soon. )

I have to wait another two weeks before I can reach my Xbox one (Halo 5, Fallout 4, I'm coming home soon. )

College? Why not bring it there..?

My parents didn't want me playing video games, thought it'd distract me from my work. However, I'm surprised I'm holding at a B level, even though I play KSP everyday. Granted though, I see where my mom is coming from, my roommates have I think 3 out 7 Fs in their classes.

- - - Updated - - -

PS: Though I love Fallout 4, I think I'll be playing Halo 5 for most of break.

My parents didn't want me playing video games, thought it'd distract me from my work. However, I'm surprised I'm holding at a B level, even though I play KSP everyday. Granted though, I see where my mom is coming from, my roommates have I think 3 out 7 Fs in their classes.

Eh. Either you're the kind of person that can balance their priorities, or you're not. Having a game console at college won't stop you from goofing off. Though I don't know if I should be talking - my art history lectures are more or less my sacred kerbal work time. I probably get 75% of my work done sitting in a lecture hall occasionally giving teachers snarky answers.

Though I suppose at the end of the day my Kerbal work is more helpful to me in the long run than knowing who some obscure German designer is...

PS: Though I love Fallout 4, I think I'll be playing Halo 5 for most of break.

Blasphemer.

I totally understand...

*Looks at preloaded Fallout 4 on Steam*

I can't afford Fallout 4...

Update-

IMPORTANT:

With the release of 1.0.5, please report any bugs of the current version to CobaltWolf or myself. Cooperation will lead to a swift and seamless transition from 1.0.4-1.0.5, though I don't suspect much bugs. :3

Thanks~

Edited November 9, 2015 by VenomousRequiem

Hey so I figured I'd drop off one last thing - I finished up the Redstone tank. Even more fun - this hopefully isn't just for testing; I used my new wip method of calculating dry mass and the amount of fuel, so hopefully everything works well. Additionally, I placed it in the tech tree at General Rocketry. I am leery of putting it earlier than that. Thoughts? I could move it back one node to be with the rest of the Redstone parts.

Download is available here. Put the 'EarlyRockets' folder in Gamedata/Bluedog_DB/Parts/. I haven't tested it in 1.0.5, the update dropped while I was finishing this up and I don't have time to download a new copy of the game (I have a separate install for development) and move my dev stuff over.

Edited November 9, 2015 by CobaltWolf
I wouldn't mind having the Redstone tank be with the rest of the Redstone parts, at the very least in the same node/column as the engine and control surfaces...

Redstone tank works fine, fam.

On a side note, what a way to kick off 1.0.5:

How to turn something American into something REALLY AMERICAN!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Explorer 1 doesn't sound like a very good name for a wing mounted air to ground missile though...

With 1.05 out and most of the mods I use on the fritz I think its time to take a well earned Fallout 4 sabbatical for a few months until everything is updated.

Before I go, I fired up KSP to test the Redstone tank... which is perfectly balanced for my needs. Not that I would expect anything less from BDB.

Cheers and see you after the 1.05 upheaval

Still can't afford Fallout 4, but everyone is leaving me for it...

Not only that but I learned not only would my laptop run it poorly, but I'm below the minimum requirements to run it at all.

Have fun with my hopes and dreams, you guys. Cheers.
